destroy() - Method in class de.mpg.aai.shhaa.AuthFilter
doFilter(ServletRequest, ServletResponse, FilterChain) - Method in class de.mpg.aai.shhaa.AuthFilter
calls the main service, aai authn/z handler handleAuth(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) and continues/forwards/redirects the original request to the proper location depending on the returned result: if returned AuthenticationContext's target starts with http the resulted request is redirected to the given url, otherwise it's forwarded (dispatched); on no specific target (null) it continues with the filter-chain.

E

evaluate(AuthAttributes) - Method in class de.mpg.aai.shhaa.authz.Location
determines whether the given credentials are sufficient to grant access to this location according to its (internal child) rules
determines whether the given credentials are sufficient to grant access according to this rule
evaluate(AuthAttributes) - Method in class de.mpg.aai.shhaa.authz.LogicRule
determines whether the given credentials are sufficient to grant access according to this rule
see class comment for AND/OR evaluation behavior LogicRule
evaluate(AuthAttributes) - Method in class de.mpg.aai.shhaa.authz.Requirement
determines whether the given credentials (attributes) meet the requirements of this instance;
the behavior depends strongly on the value of Requirement.modeMiss: false (default) - means REQUIRED: evaluate to true if one of the given attributes matches the requirement, means (one of its) values must match Requirement.value according to this instance's Matcher.matchMode true - means MISS: expects the attribute(-value) NOT to be there/to be missed! evaluates to true if NONE of the given attributes matches
evaluate(AuthAttributes) - Method in interface de.mpg.aai.shhaa.authz.Rule
determines whether the given credentials are sufficient to grant access according to this rule

H

handleAuth(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) - Method in class de.mpg.aai.shhaa.HttpAuthService
main function to handle the whole authn/z flow, handles retrieval of the current authentication context (status), loads user attributes (for access-control) checks access-permission (authorization) of the current user for the requested resource and provides AAIServletRequest with proper authentication data (and possibly a reroute target (e.g.
HttpAuthService - Class in de.mpg.aai.shhaa
the aai-authn/z handler, main service to handle fetching authentication data, authorization and setting return targets (basic "view control")

default constructor

J

JaasAttbResolver - Class in de.mpg.aai.shhaa.resolver
implementation of AttributeResolverModule to plug-in JAAS for attribute-resolving; takes the jaas config file SECTION name from the configuration and invokes jaas: enables client developers to add thus their own implementations to resolve attributes for the given Subject (and add them as AuthAttribute to the Subject's public credentials

resolve(Subject, HttpServletRequest) - Method in interface de.mpg.aai.shhaa.resolver.AttributeResolverModule
resolves (loads/retrieves/fetches) attributes (AuthAttribute) for the given user from the given request (or somewhere else) AND add those as (public) credentials to the given subject
resolve(Subject, HttpServletRequest) - Method in class de.mpg.aai.shhaa.resolver.JaasAttbResolver
resolves (loads/retrieves/fetches) attributes (AuthAttribute) for the given user from the given request (or somewhere else) AND add those as (public) credentials to the given subject
invokes LoginContext with a single NameCallbackHandler providing the given subject's username (to be used by the jaas LoginModules to retrieve the username in order to lookup attributes for/by it)
resolve(Subject, HttpServletRequest) - Method in class de.mpg.aai.shhaa.resolver.ShibHeaderAttbResolver
resolves (loads/retrieves/fetches) shibboleth attributes (AuthAttribute) for the given user from the given request and add those as (public) credentials to the given subject
